title: Libya's political division complicates flood response efforts
description: The North African country is split between two governments: one in the east of the country, where deadly floods occurred on Sunday, September 10, and the other in the west, recognized by the international community.

title: Rugby World Cup: Ireland crushes Tonga as Johnny Sexton sets scoring record
description: Johnny Sexton's record-breaking performance leads Ireland to a dominant 59-16 victory over Tonga, setting the stage for a showdown with defending champions South Africa.

title: Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger sign mutual defense pact
description: The Liptako-Gourma Charter signed on Saturday binds the signatories to assist one another – including militarily – in the event of an attack on any one of them and to work to prevent or settle armed rebellions.

title: US auto strike: 'The balance of power is swinging back in favor of the employees'
description: As job opportunities remain scarce and corporate profits soar, the UAW's call for wage hikes coincides with an economic upturn after a year of inflation, observes economic columnist Philippe Escande.

title: Rugby World Cup: Wales beats Portugal 28-8 to remain undefeated in Pool C
description: Wales scored a bonus-point fourth try in the last play to beat Portugal without ever completely subduing the feisty underdog appearing in its first Rugby World Cup game in 16 years on Saturday.

title: 'Elon Musk,' a biography of the multibillionaire and his demons
description: Released this week, this imposing account of the life of the CEO of Tesla, SpaceX and X (formely Twitter), describes a visionary but brutal man consumed by anger.

title: Ukraine: The stigma of Izium, one year after being freed from Russian occupation
description: To drive through Izium today, a year after its liberation by the Ukrainian armed forces, is to see the remnants of hell. The town, which had 45,000 residents before the Russian invasion, is still scarred by the extent of the Russian shelling.

title: France suspends student mobility with Niger, Mali and Burkina Faso
description: At the end of August, students from the three countries received a message from the French foreign ministry informing them of the cancellation of their stay in France due to an ongoing diplomatic crisis.

title: Lampedusa migration crisis: French far right puts pressure on Macron
description: With thousands of people arriving on the Italian island, far-right parties once again claimed a risk of 'submersion' was threatening France. President Macron, meanwhile, spoke of a 'duty of European solidarity' to help Italy.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Ireland's Josh van der Flier, the discreet best player in the world
description: Little known to the general public, the 30-year-old flanker is nevertheless a key member of Ireland's team, which faces Tonga in Nantes on Saturday.

title: Facing unabated inflation, Turks look for ways to make do
description: Despite a shift in monetary policy, prices continue to rise, and life for local residents is becoming increasingly difficult.

title: Iran: Mahsa Amini's father briefly detained on anniversary of her death
description: The parents of the 22-year-old Kurdish woman, who died in police custody in September 2022, had declared they would hold a ceremony to commemorate the death of their daughter. Rights groups said they were prevented from doing so.

title: Chinese defense minister's strange disappearance fuels rumors
description: United States officials told the Financial Times Li Shangfu was under investigation and had been relieved of his duties. Meanwhile, former foreign minister Qin Gang has not been seen in public since June 28.

title: 'While we celebrate our heritage for two days a year, we are steadily destroying it the rest of the time'
description: Although the annual European Heritage Days put a spotlight on castles and cathedrals, the public budget allocated to the restoration and use of notable buildings falls far short of requirements, and these sites are caught up in political and identity-related issues, writes Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: France-Sahel relations: Culture should build bridges, not walls
description: It's not by ordering the suspension of 'all cooperation projects' with Mali, Niger, and Burkina Faso that Paris can hope to win back the hearts of Africans, but by using the soft power of its language, universities and cultural institutions.

title: One year after Mahsa Amini's death, Iranian dissidents lead silent struggle for an 'uncompromising life'
description: The brutal repression of the September 2022 uprising left around 500 people dead and put an end to street protests. While no political change has emerged, the struggle between the authorities and the people continues in the form of low-key resistance from women and the men who support them.

title: Brussels attacks trial: 'Man in the hat' Abrini sentenced 30 years, Paris attacker Abdeslam avoids new life term
description: A Brussels criminal court handed down sentences to eight men convicted for their roles in the terrorist attacks on March 22, 2016, at Zaventem airport and at the Maelbeek metro station.

title: 'Measuring the state of the economy is a guessing game'
description: With the Covid-19 pandemic and widespread inflation, economic indicators have become particularly unreliable recently, writes Le Monde's Eric Albert in his column.

title: Prosecutor seeks gag order on Trump for inflammatory rhetoric
description: The Special Counsel asked a judge for a gag order on the former US president, claiming his inflammatory remarks could prejudice the jury pool and lead to real threats against officials in his election subversion trial.

title: Translating Salman Rushdie: 'I've been offered a pseudonym, but I've always refused'
description: One year after he was attacked at a literary festival, Salman Rushdie is publishing his new novel 'Victory City' in French, translated by Gérard Meudal – who works under his real name, in spite of the fatwa against the author.

title: Two Russians and American astronauts dock at the International Space Station
description: In a rare display of international cooperation, Russian and American astronauts lifted off from the Baikonur cosmodrome in Kazakhstan aboard the Soyuz MS-24 spacecraft amid ongoing tensions over Ukraine.

title: The US Constitution poses an obstacle on Donald Trump's road to the presidency
description: Section 3 of the 14th Amendment bars individuals who have sworn to uphold the Constitution and engaged in a rebellion from holding public office. Legal experts argue this disqualifies the former US president from the 2024 election.

title: Island of Lampedusa: Epicenter of the European migration crisis
description: On September 13, the small Italian island located less than 150 kilometers from the African coast, saw up to 6,800 people arrive from Tunisia in makeshift boats, the majority of them from sub-Saharan Africa.
